messages.content: <QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to approach (beginning of a process)</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>to approach (beginning of a process)</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>aheai</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to be in the process of approaching</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>to be in the process of approaching</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>aheo</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to have the habit of being found near a certain place at a certain time of day</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>to have the habit of being found near a certain place at a certain time of day</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>aheoprou</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>1. to approach (continuation of aheai), 2. to not be afraid of approaching (a relative, a hostile person)</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>1. to approach (continuation of aheai), 2. to not be afraid of approaching (a relative, a hostile person)</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ahetou</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to bring heavy or bulky objects a little closer to where one wants to carry them</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>to bring heavy or bulky objects a little closer to where one wants to carry them</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>aheamai</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to be close</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>to be close</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ahete</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>indicates that an act will be carried out at another place, at a certain distance from the place of utterance</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>indicates that an act will be carried out at another place, at a certain distance from the place of utterance</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>aharu</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>now</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>now</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>rë</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>(name)</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>(name)</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ãhi</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>i approached the luña</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>i approached the luña</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>etemakema</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to keep close</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>to keep close</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ahetepou</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to bring heavy or bulky objects close</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>to bring heavy or bulky objects close</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ahetepramai</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to quickly shorten the distance</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>to quickly shorten the distance</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ahetetai</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to quickly bring something close</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>to quickly bring something close</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ahetetamai</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>close</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>close</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ahetea</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to get muddy</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>to get muddy</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ãhiãi</YANOMAMI>

<TRANSLATION>to make muddy</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ãhiãmai</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>ant</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>ant</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>titi</YANOMAMI>

<TRANSLATION>direct line</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>línea directa</YANOMAMI>

<TRANSLATION>elder</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>mayor</YANOMAMI>

<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>my</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>my</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>ia</YANOMAMI>
<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>tongue</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
<TRANSLATION>tongue</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>aka</YANOMAMI>

<TRANSLATION>i give things away for nothing</TRANSLATION> <YANOMAMI>doy por nada</YANOMAMI>

<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to enroll, to wrap around</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>

<QUERY>How do you say <TRANSLATION>to scrape one</TRANSLATION> in Yanomami?</QUERY>
